Google.eligibility: Bachelor degree (BTech, MCA, BCA); Diploma holders/BA cannot apply

key_notes.tip-1: Focus on fundamentals and thinking structure
key_notes.tip-3: Permanent role (PPO) chances are very high after internship

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Build foundation in DSA (Arrays, Strings, Linked List, Stacks, Queues, Graphs)
preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Solve 50-60 problems on Leetcode or GeeksforGeeks in January
preparation_strategy.strategy-3: Build one simple full stack project

Google.notes: One of the dream companies for most students.

Google-2.eligibility: Second year students; mostly for girls
Google-2.conversion_to_ppo: PPI in third year if performance is good

key_notes.tip-1: Resume should be ATS friendly with top-notch projects
key_notes.tip-2: Judgment is purely based on DSA
key_notes.tip-3: One of the best programs for women in tech

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Build serious projects for resume boosting

Google-2.notes: Step internship is specifically designed for early-year students.

Microsoft.eligibility: First year and second year undergraduates in Computer Science (BTech, BSc, BCA); Not open for MCA
Microsoft.timeline: Opens around November; check between May and July

key_notes.tip-1: Designed as a pipeline program
key_notes.tip-3: Check between May and July for updates

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Prepare early to avoid missing deadlines

Microsoft.notes: A great opportunity for 1st and 2nd year students.

Microsoft-2.eligibility: Bachelor or Master degree in CS or related IT field; must have at least one semester remaining after internship
Microsoft-2.selection_criteria: Strong knowledge of algorithms and DSA

key_notes.tip-1: Must be able to solve Leetcode problems
key_notes.tip-2: Must be in 1st, 2nd, or 3rd year (not final year)

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Practice solving problems on Leetcode

Microsoft-2.notes: This is an offline internship requiring relocation to Bangalore.

Amazon.hire: Direct application on Amazon.jobs or rolling basis
Amazon.eligibility: Pre-final and final year students (graduating after 2026); BTech, MBA, BCA, ASIT
Amazon.timeline: March to May / September to December

key_notes.tip-1: Relocation and housing expenses are covered
key_notes.tip-2: Apply early as applications are on rolling basis
key_notes.tip-3: Chance to work at a top product based company

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Watch for rolling application updates

Amazon.notes: Amazon offers good relocation and housing support for interns.

Amazon-2.eligibility: First to third year female students only
Amazon-2.selection_criteria: Higher selection chances for female candidates
Amazon-2.conversion_to_ppo: Provides intern and full-time job opportunities

key_notes.tip-1: Typically happens once a year
key_notes.tip-2: Mentorship program for women in tech

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Keep an eye on Amazon Wow portal

Amazon-2.notes: Diversity hiring program with high preference for females.

Uber.hire: Hackathon based competition; top 3 teams get rewards
Uber.eligibility: Engineering students; third year or final year
Uber.selection_criteria: Top teams get cash prizes and interview calls

key_notes.tip-1: Top teams get cash prizes worth 5 lakh

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Focus on good problem solving skills
preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Master DSA at an advanced level
preparation_strategy.strategy-3: Form a strong team for hackathon

Uber.notes: Uber is known for asking high-level DSA questions.

Flipkart.hire: Four round process: Quiz, coding assessment, case study based coding, National Finals

key_notes.tip-1: India's largest engineering campus challenge
key_notes.tip-2: Can participate solo or in teams

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Prepare for quiz and coding assessment rounds
preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Participate in case study coding

Flipkart.notes: Flipkart Grid is a major gateway for non-diversity hiring.

Flipkart-2.eligibility: Second and third year female students

key_notes.tip-1: Top 500 get interview skills workshops
key_notes.tip-2: Investing in women engineers early on

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Focus on networking and resume building

Flipkart-3.hire: Coding challenge followed by mentorship and PPI
Flipkart-3.eligibility: Women in 3rd/4th year BTech or 1st/2nd year MTech
Flipkart-3.selection_criteria: Top 30 performers get all-expense paid trip

key_notes.tip-1: Top 30 performers visit Bangalore headquarters

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Prepare for the initial coding challenge

Flipkart-3.notes: Prestigious program with high PPO packages.

Goldman Sachs.hire: Competitive coding contest on platforms like Hacker Rank
Goldman Sachs.eligibility: Bachelor or Master degree students (Final and Pre-final year); Accepts all engineering branches and MCA/BCA
Goldman Sachs.selection_criteria: Ability to solve Leetcode contest problems fast

key_notes.tip-1: Extremely competitive with low conversion rates

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Master fast problem solving on Leetcode
preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Participate in bi-weekly and weekly contests
preparation_strategy.strategy-3: Apply on day one of opening

Goldman Sachs.notes: Fintech giant with a brutal but rewarding hiring process.

American Express.eligibility: Technical degree students (CSE, IT, ECE); girls in 1st to 4th year
American Express.conversion_to_ppo: Chance to secure PPO after internship

key_notes.tip-1: Global financial company

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Form a team and participate in hackathon
preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Monitor career page in Q1

American Express.notes: Popular program for women in technical degrees.

LinkedIn.hire: Mentorship program by LinkedIn engineers; includes a hackathon
LinkedIn.eligibility: Second year female students in BTech/BE

key_notes.tip-1: Mentors are actual engineers from LinkedIn

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Showcase strong skills during internship

LinkedIn.notes: One of the most valuable mentorship programs available.

EY.hire: Annual tech competition/hackathon based on case studies
EY.eligibility: Second, third, or final year engineering students
EY.stipend_ctc: 40,000 stipend; winning prize up to 3 lakh
EY.selection_criteria: Based on case studies and articulation

key_notes.tip-1: Focuses heavily on AI and Generative AI
key_notes.tip-3: One of the big four companies

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Build projects using AI tools

EY.notes: EY focuses more on case studies than pure coding.

JP Morgan.eligibility: Second or third year tech students; 7 CGPA or 70% minimum requirement
JP Morgan.timeline: February to March / September to October

key_notes.tip-1: Winning teams can get international PPO
key_notes.tip-3: Well-known company with great brand name

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Prepare for intense 24-hour coding

JP Morgan.notes: Allows students to potentially go international for work.

Adobe.hire: Direct hiring based on DSA and development skills

key_notes.tip-1: Adobe brand adds massive credibility
key_notes.tip-3: Requires pre-final or final year status

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Master full stack development
preparation_strategy.strategy-3: Monitor career portal in late summer

Adobe.notes: Adobe is highly selective but offers great PPO packages.

Walmart.selection_criteria: Selection based primarily on DSA skills

key_notes.tip-1: Diversity hiring contest

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Practice for the online coding challenge

Trilogy.hire: Competitive programming contest; difficult interview rounds

key_notes.tip-1: Includes training in Dubai
key_notes.tip-3: One of the highest paying internships

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Practice for very difficult interview rounds

Trilogy.notes: Often known for providing the 'highest' stipend amounts.

Juspay.hire: Programming rounds, deep programming, and hackathon style tests
Juspay.eligibility: Third year and final year students

key_notes.tip-1: Focuses more on development than DSA

preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Gain prior internship experience

Juspay.notes: Process focuses on deep engineering skills.

Oracle.hire: Direct application via career portal, profile creation, CV upload
Oracle.eligibility: Current students, freshers (0 to 2 years experience), English proficiency required

key_notes.tip-1: Real project involvement

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Create profile on Oracle career portal
preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Upload ATS-friendly resume
preparation_strategy.strategy-3: Prepare for tech roles in cloud/SDE
